I'd like to run JUnit under an in house framework and I don't know how to d=
o it. Our framework starts services and agents that look something like thi=
s:

class ExampleAgent implements IAgent {

	public static IAgent createAge=
nt(...) { ...}

	public void start() {
		// Assumption is that this will st=
art the agent in a thread and return.
	}
}

Once an agent is started it has=
 access to various services supplied by the Framework; its these services I=
'd like to unit test. I'd guess that I need to create a IAgent that extends=
 JUnit's TestCase and implements the functionality of JUnit's main methods.=
 I'd also like the tests to run using either JUnit's GUI or its text driver=
.

Any tips would be a great help. Thanks.
-Christopher Helck
subject: JUnit in a framework
